gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Dissolved Fe Zn Cd conc and isotopes from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Dissolved Fe, Zn and Cd concentrations and isotope ratios Dataset Description: <p>Dissolved (0.2 micron filtered) Iron, Zinc and Cadmium concentrations and isotope ratios.&nbsp;</p><p>Concentration data is to be made freely available. Isotope data (columns L-Q in dataset) are to be restricted until July 2014.</p><p><strong>DMO NOTE:</strong><br />- version 4: 2015-01-16. Fe and Fe_err changed for sample 6128.<br />- replaces version 3: Revised data served on 5/21/2014. Zn_err_2s changed for samples 7765 and 7767; sample 6862 flag was changed from 2 to 1.<br />- replaces version 2: 1 January 2014<br />- replaces version 1: 7 January 2013</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling and Analytical Methodology:&nbsp; </strong><br />Samples were provided from the GEOTRACES trace-metal clean sampling rosette and were sampled into acid-cleaned 1L LDPE bottles by the onboard GEOTRACES clean sampling team. Upon receipt of samples on shore, they were acidified to pH 2 using clean hydrochloric acid and left at this pH for at least 3 months before processing. Every sample was simultaneously extracted and purified for the analysis of d56Fe, d66Zn, d114Cd, [Fe], [Zn], and [Cd] using published methods (Conway et al., 2013). Briefly, Fe, Zn, and Cd double-spikes were added to the acidified samples and allowed to equilibrate for &gt; 1 hour. Metals were then extracted from seawater onto an ethylenediaminetriacetic acid resin (Nobias PA-1; Hitachi) for 2 hours at pH 2 and 2 hours at pH between 6-6.3. Metals were eluted off this resin using 3 N HNO3, and were then purified by anion exchange chromatography before being reconstituted in 0.1 N HNO3 for analysis.</p><p>Concentrations and stable isotope ratios were determined simultaneously by analysis on a Neptune multi-collector ICP-MS. Fe and Zn were analyzed in high resolution mode, while Cd was analyzed in low resolution mode. Every sample was analyzed twice, and the mean isotope ratios are presented here, expressed relative to international isotope standards. Instrumental and procedural isotopic fractionation was corrected for using a double-spike data reduction scheme.&nbsp;</p><p>Concentrations were calculated using isotope-dilution to calculate ng of metal per sample, and then converted to nmol kg-1 or pmol kg-1 using the weight of each sample processed. Concentration numbers represent the mean of two ICP-MS analyses of each sample. The largest sources of error for concentration analyses are determining the weight of the sample and determining the volume of double-spike added to each sample. We approximate 2% error for each sample based on the combination of these two factors. Accuracy was checked by analysis of S, D1 and D2 SAFe reference standards (for which we determined values identical to the consensus values; see Conway et al, 2013) and inter-comparison with two other groups measuring trace metal concentrations on US GEOTRACES NAZT samples.&nbsp;</p><p>Analytical accuracy of stable isotope ratios is equal to the analytical precision (i.e. the analysis is free from systematic errors; John, 2012) and is calculated separately for each sample. Uncertainty for isotope ratios is expressed as the 2 sigma uncertainty on the average isotope ratio, calculated from a combination of the internal standard error of each of two measurements and the bracketing isotope standards used, as described in Conway et al., (2013).&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1131387 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=1131387
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0929491 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0929491

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31650.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: dimensionless Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31651.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: alphanumeric Description: synonym used by the project to describe the cruise. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31652.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31654.rdf Name: bottle Units: dimensionless Description: Niskin bottle of 24-bottle sequence; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31655.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31656.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: water depth at which bottle tripped; provided in original data submission. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31657.rdf Name: Cd Units: nanomole/kilogram Description: Cadmium concentration < 0.2 um http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31658.rdf Name: Cd_err Units: dimensionless Description: Cadmium error; 2% of concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31659.rdf Name: delta_114Cd Units: 0/00 Description: mean Cd stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((114Cd/110Cd)sample/(114Cd/110Cd)NIST SRM 3108 -1)*1000 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31660.rdf Name: Cd_err_2s Units: dimensionless Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Cd http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31661.rdf Name: Fe Units: nanomole/kilogram Description: Iron concentration < 0.2 um http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31662.rdf Name: Fe_err Units: dimensionless Description: Iron error; 2% of concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31663.rdf Name: delta_56Fe Units: 0/00 Description: mean Fe stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((54Fe/56Fe)sample/(54Fe/56Fe)IRMM-014-1)*1000 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31664.rdf Name: Fe_err_2s Units: dimensionless Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Fe http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31665.rdf Name: Zn Units: nanomole/kilogram Description: Zinc concentration < 0.2 um http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31666.rdf Name: Zn_err Units: dimensionless Description: Zinc error; 2% of concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31667.rdf Name: delta_66Zn Units: 0/00 Description: mean Zn stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((66Zn/64Zn)sample/(66Zn/64Zn)Lyons JMC-1)*1000 http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31668.rdf Name: Zn_err_2s Units: dimensionless Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Zn http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31669.rdf Name: flag Units: integer Description: Data quality flag; 1 (good) or 2 (questionable) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31670.rdf Name: date Units: yyyymmdd Description: date of cast, UTC http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31671.rdf Name: lat_sta Units: decimal degrees Description: nominal station latitude; North is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/31672.rdf Name: lon_sta Units: decimal degrees Description: nominal station longitude; East is positive http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33100.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33101.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33102.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33103.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33104.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/33105.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P03/current/C035/ Name: Metal and metalloid concentrations Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: synonym used by the project to describe the cruise.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in theintermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'station', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Niskin bottle of 24-bottle sequence; provided in original data submission.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'sample', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: water depth at which bottle tripped; provided in original data submission.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Cadmium concentration < 0.2 um; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.
PI-supplied Description: Cadmium error; 2% of concentration; General Description: Cadmium error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition
PI-supplied Description: mean Cd stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((114Cd/110Cd)sample/(114Cd/110Cd)NIST SRM 3108 -1)*1000; General Description: Cadmium-114 to Cadmium-110 ratio
PI-supplied Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Cd; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Iron concentration < 0.2 um; General Description: Fe (Iron) concentration. May be reported in parts per million, nanomoles/Liter, or other units. Refer to dataset metadata for units.
PI-supplied Description: Iron error; 2% of concentration; General Description: Iron error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition
PI-supplied Description: mean Fe stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((54Fe/56Fe)sample/(54Fe/56Fe)IRMM-014-1)*1000; General Description: ratio of Fe-54 to Fe-56
PI-supplied Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Fe; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Zinc concentration < 0.2 um; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.
PI-supplied Description: Zinc error; 2% of concentration; General Description: zinc error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition
PI-supplied Description: mean Zn stable isotope ratio; units of permil (0/00) = ((66Zn/64Zn)sample/(66Zn/64Zn)Lyons JMC-1)*1000; General Description: Zinc-66 to Zinc-64 ratio
PI-supplied Description: 2 sigma uncertainty in dissolved Zn; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Data quality flag; 1 (good) or 2 (questionable); General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: date of cast, UTC; General Description: UTC month, day and year, usually as a text string, e.g. feb10_1995. It is better to use one of the other forms of presenting date and time data so that the data can be used in computations and for comparisons. Note, if the string begins with numbers but also includes letters, there may be problems using the field name for retrieval. Use date_gmt for future data sets.

PI-supplied Description: nominal station latitude; North is positive; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: nominal station longitude; East is positive; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling and Analytical Methodology:&nbsp; </strong><br />Samples were provided from the GEOTRACES trace-metal clean sampling rosette and were sampled into acid-cleaned 1L LDPE bottles by the onboard GEOTRACES clean sampling team. Upon receipt of samples on shore, they were acidified to pH 2 using clean hydrochloric acid and left at this pH for at least 3 months before processing. Every sample was simultaneously extracted and purified for the analysis of d56Fe, d66Zn, d114Cd, [Fe], [Zn], and [Cd] using published methods (Conway et al., 2013). Briefly, Fe, Zn, and Cd double-spikes were added to the acidified samples and allowed to equilibrate for &gt; 1 hour. Metals were then extracted from seawater onto an ethylenediaminetriacetic acid resin (Nobias PA-1; Hitachi) for 2 hours at pH 2 and 2 hours at pH between 6-6.3. Metals were eluted off this resin using 3 N HNO3, and were then purified by anion exchange chromatography before being reconstituted in 0.1 N HNO3 for analysis.</p><p>Concentrations and stable isotope ratios were determined simultaneously by analysis on a Neptune multi-collector ICP-MS. Fe and Zn were analyzed in high resolution mode, while Cd was analyzed in low resolution mode. Every sample was analyzed twice, and the mean isotope ratios are presented here, expressed relative to international isotope standards. Instrumental and procedural isotopic fractionation was corrected for using a double-spike data reduction scheme.&nbsp;</p><p>Concentrations were calculated using isotope-dilution to calculate ng of metal per sample, and then converted to nmol kg-1 or pmol kg-1 using the weight of each sample processed. Concentration numbers represent the mean of two ICP-MS analyses of each sample. The largest sources of error for concentration analyses are determining the weight of the sample and determining the volume of double-spike added to each sample. We approximate 2% error for each sample based on the combination of these two factors. Accuracy was checked by analysis of S, D1 and D2 SAFe reference standards (for which we determined values identical to the consensus values; see Conway et al, 2013) and inter-comparison with two other groups measuring trace metal concentrations on US GEOTRACES NAZT samples.&nbsp;</p><p>Analytical accuracy of stable isotope ratios is equal to the analytical precision (i.e. the analysis is free from systematic errors; John, 2012) and is calculated separately for each sample. Uncertainty for isotope ratios is expressed as the 2 sigma uncertainty on the average isotope ratio, calculated from a combination of the internal standard error of each of two measurements and the bracketing isotope standards used, as described in Conway et al., (2013).&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Data Processing</strong>:<br />Data are flagged as 1 (good) or 2 (questionable). Data points flagged as questionable are considered to be potential outliers. This may be because the difference between replicate analyses is much larger than the presumed analytical error, (the separation between two replicates was &gt; 4x the 2s error) or because the data appear oceanographically inconsistent (e.g. values which are very different from samples taken above and below), even though there is no obvious analytical reason to dismiss them.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>References</strong><br />Conway, T.M., Rosenberg, A.D., Adkins, J.F., and S.G. John. &nbsp;2013. &nbsp;A new method for precise determination of iron, zinc and cadmium stable isotope ratios in seawater by double-spike mass spectrometry. &nbsp;Analytica Chimica Acta, 793: &nbsp;44-52.</p><p>John, S.&nbsp; 2012.&nbsp; Optimizing sample and spike concentrations for isotopic analysis by double-spike ICP-MS.&nbsp; Journal of Analytical Atomic Spectrometry, 27:&nbsp; 2123-2131.</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Teflon TM Instrument Description: GO-FLO Teflon-lined Trace Metal free sampling bottles are used for collecting water samples for trace metal, nutrient and pigment analysis. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is designed specifically to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GeoFish Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer PI Supplied Instrument Description:Neptune multi-collector ICP-MS Instrument Name: Mass Spectrometer Instrument Short Name:Mass Spec Instrument Description: General term for instruments used to measure the mass-to-charge ratio of ions; generally used to find the composition of a sample by generating a mass spectrum representing the masses of sample components. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB16/
